books.title: The First Men in the Moon
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two British men become the first humans to reach the Moon.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Smoky the Cowhorse
books.author: Will James
books.summary: Smoky, a gray-colored horse, grows into adulthood on the ranges of the American West.

books.title: Manalive
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: An eccentric man brings chaos and happiness to a house of litigious lodgers.

books.title: Edward II
books.author: Christopher Marlowe
books.summary: Outraged by the favoritism shown by King Edward II to a close confidant, his court plots against him.

books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: Niels Lyhne
books.author: J. P. Jacobsen
books.summary: A young, disillusioned poet struggles to find love and meaning in 19th century Denmark.

books.title: The Private Memoirs and Confessions of a Justified Sinner
books.author: James Hogg
books.summary: A religious fanatic’s mysterious friend helps turn him into a killer.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: The D’Arblay Mystery
books.author: R. Austin Freeman
books.summary: A doctor finds himself entangled in the mysterious death of an artist after discovering his body in a secluded pond.

books.title: The Subjection of Women
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: John Stuart Mill argues for the social and legal equality of men and women.

books.title: On Liberty
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: Mill’s famous essay that applies a utilitarian ethical system to systems of government.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: The Big Time
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A motley collection of servicemembers escape a plot as two mysterious factions wage an epic war across time itself.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.
